comments.author: Derp

comments.text:
Hi, Roger - I stopped over in Iceland once. All the duty-free shops were 
open even though it was really late and I bought two spectacular blankets!! 
I met someone another time who told me people in the capital still leave 
their doors open when they go out ... imagine!! It felt like a really nice 
place. I'd like to go back and experience the moonscape lands and the hot 
springs!﻿

comments.author: Gill Wu

comments.text:
I did a one night stop over last year on my way to London. It is a great 
way to sample the country before you decide to take a longer trip. I would 
love to go back and spend more time seeing the beauties of that country but 
would never fly from Dulles airport again as my experience with the check 
in personnel was less then satisfactory,﻿

comments.author: C.C. Chapman

comments.text:
like everyone can stop over unexpectedly! What happens to that expensive 
Airport taxi/bus or family/friends that are waiting for you? I used to fly 
Icelandair, I enjoyed the stop over since it's a short one and you can 
stretch your legs and they were cheaper than a lot of airlines. But that 
changed all of a sudden! They are now a lot more expensive! and that for a 
stop-over flight! I have found a cheaper one that even flys direct!﻿
